item.title: Astrid add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Everything you can imagine is real." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Edgar Degas
item.description: "Art is not what you see, but what you make others see." -- Edgar Degas

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Stella Adler
item.description: "life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one" -- Stella Adler

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Alain de Botton
item.description: "to design means forcing ourselves to unlearn what we believe we already know, patiently to take apart the mechanisms behind our reflexes and to acknowledge the mystery and stupefying complexity of everyday gestures like switching off a light of turning on a tap" -- Alain de Botton

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "They came to her, naturally, since she was a woman, all day long with this and that; one wanting this, another that; the children were growing up; she often felt she was nothing but a sponge sopped full of human emotions." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "If Shakespeare had never existed, he asked, would the world have differed much from what it is today? Does the progress of civilization depend upon great men? Is the lot of the average human being better now that in the time of the Pharaohs?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "It was love, she thought, love that never clutch its object; but, like the love which mathematicians bear their symbols, or poets their phrases, was meant to be spread over the world and become part of human gain. The world by all means should have shared it, could Mr Bankes have said why that woman pleased him so; why the sight of her reading a fairy tale to her boy had upon him precisely the same effect as the solution of a scientific problem." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Oh, but she never wanted James to grow a day older or Cam either. These two she would have liked to keep for ever just as the way they were, demons of wickedness, angels of delight, never to see them grow up into long-legged monsters." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself" -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "â€ŽA day in which I don't write leaves a taste of ashes." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Peter Carey
item.description: "If you ever read one of my books I hope you'll think it looks so easy. In fact, I wrote those chapters 20 times over, and over, and over, and that if you want to write at a good level, you'll have to do that too." -- Peter Carey

item.title: Astrid add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "But better die than live mechanically a life that is a repetition of repetitions." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Astrid add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Astrid add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "As we all know, too much of any divine thing is destruction" -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "To lose a brother is to lose someone with whom you can share the experience of growing old, who is supposed to bring you a sister-in-law and nieces and nephews, creatures who people the tree of your life and give it new branches. To lose your father is to lose the one whose guidance and help you seek, who supports you like a tree trunk supports its branches. To lose your mother, well, that is like losing the sun above you. It is like losing--I'm sorry, I would rather not go on." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Astrid add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Lack of originality, everywhere, all over the world, from time immemorial, has always been considered the foremost quality and the recommendation of the active, efficient and practical man." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Astrid add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "Be still when you have nothing to say; when genuine passion moves you, say what you've got to say, and say it hot." -- D.H. Lawrence

item.title: Astrid add a quote by D.H. Lawrence
item.description: "For my part, I prefer my heart to be broken. It is so lovely, dawn-kaleidoscopic within the crack." -- D.H. Lawrence
